summary: This document is an email chain from May 2020 among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing scheduling a meeting about the Epstein probate case. It includes a forwarded update from February 2020 detailing legal developments, including the Virgin Islands Attorney General's actions against Epstein's estate, demands for a victim compensation program, and the freezing of estate assets.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Person who wants to schedule a Webex meeting to discuss planning litigation with the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.context: Brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged his lawyers were part of his fraud, and is making demands regarding the victim compensation program.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual whose estate is the subject of the probate proceedings and victim claims.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named by Epstein as an executor of his will; alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Named by Epstein as an executor of his will; alleged by the Virgin Islands AG to have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Representing Epstein's estate in court, claimed liens have left him unable to release money for a victim compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Oversaw claims for 9/11, Catholic church abuse, and BP oil spill; was reportedly asked to oversee a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of the Guardian article referenced in the email chain.

connections.description: Indyke was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor of his will.
Kahn was Epstein's lawyer and was named as an executor of his will.
Both were named as co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will.
George's office alleged Indyke may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud and planned to name him as a co-defendant.
George's office alleged Kahn may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud and planned to name him as a co-defendant.
Moskowitz is representing the estate for which Indyke is an executor.
Moskowitz is representing the estate for which Kahn is an executor.
George's actions (liens) are impeding the victim compensation fund that Moskowitz, representing the estate, is trying to establish.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG Denied Intervention in Probate
events.description: The probate court denied the Virgin Islands Attorney General's motion to intervene in the Epstein probate proceedings.

events.title: Estate Bank Accounts Frozen
events.description: The estate's bank accounts were frozen due to liens filed by the Virgin Islands Attorney General, who demands prior approval for all expenditures.

events.title: Executors Seek Emergency Relief
events.description: The executors moved the probate court for emergency relief to gain full access to estate funds to pay administrative expenses without the AG's prior approval.

events.title: AG Outlines Demands for Victim Compensation
events.description: The Virgin Islands AG sent a letter to the executors laying out demands for a fair victim compensation program, including cooperation with investigations and waiving NDAs.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG Brings Charges Against Estate
events.description: Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged his lawyers may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest on Federal Charges
events.description: Epstein was arrested on fresh federal sex trafficking and conspiracy charges.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Guilty Plea
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to a Florida state prostitution charge and served a 13-month jail sentence.

keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has filed liens freezing the bank accounts of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, demanding prior approval for all expenditures.
George has brought charges against the estate and alleged that Epstein's lawyers and executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

Key demands from the Virgin Islands AG for a victim compensation program include the estate cooperating with investigations, waiving NDAs for former employees, and not requiring victims to sign third-party releases.
The executors of the estate have sought emergency relief from the probate court to access funds without the AG's prior approval to pay administrative expenses.
A victim compensation fund overseen by Ken Feinberg was proposed but faced opposition from the Virgin Islands AG and some victim lawyers who argued it would maintain secrecy.
